title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 19 October 2015 - XWiki
content:
<polx> has quit  
00:48 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
01:13 <polx> has quit  
07:00 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:19 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
08:04 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:13 <cjd> has quit  
08:18 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
08:18 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
08:29 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:34 <woshilapin> has quit  
08:46 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
08:46 <DarkKnightCZ1> has joined #xwiki  
08:49 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:59 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <vmassol> cjd: good morning. In English, what's correct: "Child Pages" or "Children Pages"?  
09:17 <cjd> "Child Pages"  
09:17 <cjd> good morning  
09:17 <vmassol> ok thx  
09:18 <cjd> hey, this weekend I wrote a fuzz test for CryptoAuth and it hit 85% code coverage  
09:18 <vmassol> fast to execute?  
09:18 <cjd> what's cooler is the fuzz test is only 327 lines long (including everything)  
09:18 <cjd> 1/2 second of fuzzing covers 85%  
09:19 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <vmassol> if it's fuzzy then I guess the coverage varies across runs?  
09:19 <cjd> and the code it covers is 1100 lines so it's 2.85 lines covered per line of test  
09:19 <cjd> yup  
09:20 <cjd> I like this consept of "test leverage" (lines covered per line of test) because it encourages good tests and testable code  
09:20 <cjd> so with my static tests, I'm at 91% code coverage :D  
09:21 <vmassol> I don't fully agree  
09:21 <vmassol> you can have 100% TPC and the code not work  
09:21 <cjd> yup  
09:21 <cjd> that's why I don't totally like the test coverage metric, it's just a helper  
09:21 <vmassol> not test  
09:21 <vmassol> unit test  
09:21 <vmassol> a func test will guarantee it works  
09:22 <cjd> ok, but you can have functional tests and still have crash bugs  
09:22 <cjd> weird malformed packet etc  
09:22 <vmassol> (if you have a good testing env representative of the target env)  
09:22 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <vmassol> sure  
09:23 <cjd> I use fuzzers when I am not feeling very sure of the code I'm working on  
09:23 <vmassol> it can be the combination of actions you did (and thus a memory state) leading to a bug somewhere lese  
09:23 <cjd> and CryptoAuth is an excellent example because it's a state machine and it has to handle corrupted/duplicated/reordered packets and still come to consensus  
09:25 <vmassol> I'm sure you'd like using genetic algorithms for randomizing unit tests :)  
09:26 <cjd> there's a fuzzer which uses genetic algorithms, it's called AFL  
09:26 <cjd> I have not played with it at all but it seems promising  
09:26 <vmassol> I remember a test fwk that would modify the code under test and verify if the tests were still passing as a way to validate that the tests do test something  
09:26 <cjd> yeah, mutant I think, but it's a ruby thing  
09:26 <vmassol> (need to remember the name, was coded by a friend of mine)  
09:26 <vmassol> (was in java)  
09:26 <cjd> ahh ok, jmutant probably ;)  
09:27 <vmassol> was jester  
09:27 <vmassol> seems there's more now  
09:27 <vmassol> http://pitest.org/java\_mutation\_testing\_systems/  
09:28 <cjd> But in the end I'm not fixated on 100% coverage or mutation, what I really care about is finding the cheapest way to tease out all of the bugs which are going to otherwise significantly hurt me  
09:28 <cjd> pragmetist to a fault  
09:52 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:03 <vmassol> mflorea: hi  
10:03 <mflorea> Hi vmassol  
10:03 <vmassol> any idea what I'm doing wrong at https://gist.github.com/vmassol/ffbffc028f01280f3f60 ?  
10:04 <vmassol> it keeps saying "loading..."  
10:05 <vmassol> the value of $openToSpace seems ok. For example: "xwiki:Panels"  
10:05 <mflorea> the tree displays documents in your case, so the node id is document:...  
10:06 <mflorea> followed by a document reference  
10:06 <vmassol> I've used space: not document:  
10:06 <vmassol> as explained here: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Document+Tree+Macro  
10:06 <mflorea> where exactly?  
10:06 <vmassol> "The format of a node identifier is entityType:entityReference, where the entity type can be for instance wiki, space, document. E.g.: wiki:xwiki, space:xwiki:Main, document:xwiki:Main.WebHome"  
10:07 <mflorea> yes, where does it say it must be space:  
10:07 <mflorea> it gives 3 examples  
10:07 <vmassol> it says it \*\*can\*\*  
10:07 <vmassol> it doesn't have to be  
10:07 <mflorea> yes, it can, but in your case it's not  
10:07 <vmassol> wdym?  
10:07 <vmassol> I've used space  
10:07 <vmassol> I don't understand  
10:08 <vmassol> it' s a \*\*document tree macro\*\* so it always display documents :)  
10:08 <mflorea> no  
10:08 <mflorea> it can display spaces, wikis, attachments, translations, objects, etc.  
10:08 <vmassol> "Displays the hierarchy of wiki documents using the http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Tree+Macro."  
10:08 <mflorea> all types of entities  
10:08 <vmassol> wiki \*\*documents\*\*  
10:09 <mflorea> sure, that is the main goal, but in order to display spaces the tree may need to displays spaces or wikis  
10:09 <vmassol> could you add an example using space: as the openTo or too:? because right now it's not understanble  
10:09 <mflorea> s/in order to display spaces/ in order to display documents  
10:10 <mflorea> I don't see what's not clear  
10:10 <vmassol> it doesn't work  
10:10 <mflorea> each tree node corresponds to an XWiki entity  
10:10 <vmassol> listen it's simple, I want to use the macro, I then read how to specify each param  
10:10 <mflorea> and the id of that node is entityType:entityReference  
10:11 <vmassol> so when it comes to the opento param I read the doc  
10:11 <vmassol> and the doc says:  
10:11 <vmassol> s/opentoo/root  
10:11 <vmassol> "The format of a node identifier is entityType:entityReference, where the entity type can be for instance wiki, space, document. E.g.: wiki:xwiki, space:xwiki:Main, document:xwiki:Main.WebHome"  
10:11 <mflorea> yes  
10:11 <mflorea> what is not clear here?  
10:11 <vmassol> so I use what's mentioned  
10:12 <vmassol> space:xwiki:Main  
10:12 <mflorea> it mentiones 3 options  
10:12 <vmassol> and it fails  
10:12 <mflorea> that is one of the options  
10:12 <mflorea> you didn  
10:12 <mflorea> you didn't user the right option  
10:12 <mflorea> the right id  
10:12 <mflorea> in your case the node you want to be the root is a document not a space  
10:12 <vmassol> no  
10:13 <vmassol> I want the root to be a space  
10:13 <vmassol> not a doc  
10:13 <vmassol> and the doc says I can  
10:13 <vmassol> what's not clear?  
10:13 <mflorea> it can, when the tree displays spaces  
10:13 <mflorea> in your case it doen't!!  
10:13 <vmassol> why?  
10:13 <vmassol> imagine I want to display spaces  
10:13 <vmassol> (which btw is not clear at all in the doc)  
10:13 <mflorea> because you don't have showSpaces="true"  
10:13 <vmassol> so the doc is wrong  
10:14 <mflorea> ?  
10:14 <vmassol> fixing  
10:14 <mflorea> :|  
10:16 <vmassol> let me know if it's correct  
10:18 <vmassol> Still, I don't think it shoudl fail when showSpaces=false. At least it should mention an error  
10:18 <vmassol> not just spin endelessly  
10:18 <mflorea> "Displays a hierarchy of documents, spaces or wikis using the" <---- no, it can also display objects, object properties, any XWiki entity in fact, BUT I don't think the description needs to be that explicit, the most important fact is the document hierarchy, but you cannot display the document hierarchy ignoring the fact that documents are defined inside spaces/wiki and that they have attachments, objects, etc/  
10:18 <vmassol> doesn't work btw  
10:18 <vmassol> even with showSpaces=true  
10:19 <mflorea> "If you use a ##space## type then you must also specify  ##showSpaces=true## and if you use a ##wiki## type you must specify  ##showWikis=true##" --> false!  
10:19 <mflorea> arrr  
10:19 <mflorea> if you had the patience to listen to me :)  
10:19 <vmassol> I tried but you're not explaning anything, you just keep saying that the doc is right and I use it wrongly :)  
10:19 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <mflorea> the doc is right  
10:20 <mflorea> so  
10:20 <mflorea> let me finish the explanation  
10:20 <vmassol> (the doc cannot be right since I'm not that stupid and I can't use it)  
10:21 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <polx> has quit  
10:22 <mflorea> first thing, and the most important, when you want to use the "root" parameter, the none that you want to be the root \_\_must\_\_ be displayed in the tree when root in not specified. So first you display the tree without the root parameter. You see what nodes there are in the tree. You choose a node. Depending on the entity type of that node and its reference you will compute the id that needs to be used to the root parameter  
10:23 <mflorea> if the node you selected is a document then the id needs to start with document:  
10:23 <mflorea> if the node is a space then space:  
10:24 <mflorea> if the node is a wiki, then wiki:  
10:24 <mflorea> in your case the tree displays nested documents, no spaces, so the root is a (nested) document  
10:24 <mflorea> so you must use an id like document: with the root parameter  
10:25 <vmassol> why do you keep saying "in your case"?  
10:26 <mflorea> because the tree can displays nested documents, nested spaces, parent-child, etc. depending on the parameters that you pass  
10:26 <vmassol> in my wiki I have wikis, spaces and documents  
10:26 <mflorea> no  
10:26 <mflorea> you have wikis and nested documents  
10:26 <mflorea> in 7.2+  
10:26 <mflorea> which I believe you're using  
10:26 <vmassol> from a refererence POV I have wikis, spaces and documents  
10:27 <mflorea> that's another thngs  
10:27 <mflorea> the tree displays nested documents with your current params  
10:27 <mflorea> so you need a document reference  
10:27 <vmassol> even when I use showSpaces=true?  
10:28 <mflorea> obviously no, if you use showSpaces=true then the tree will show space nodes and thus you will have to use a space reference  
10:28 <mflorea> showSpaces=true -> nested spaces  
10:28 <mflorea> showSpaces=false -> nested documents  
10:28 <vmassol> ok this didn't work either as I mentioned above  
10:29 <mflorea> paste again the macro call  
10:29 <mflorea> the current version  
10:29 <vmassol> (note this is not what I want but I wanted to verify it works and see the result for my curiosity)  
10:29 <vmassol> {{documentTree showTranslations="false" showAttachments="false" compact="true" showSpaces="true" root="space:$openToSpace" showSpaces="true" /}}  
10:30 <vmassol> (removed one showSpaces)  
10:30 <mflorea> let me try  
10:31 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <vmassol> why did you say that what I wrote is false at "E.g.: wiki:xwiki,space:xwiki:Main, document:xwiki:Main.WebHome. If you use a space type then you must also specify showSpaces=true"?  
10:33 <mflorea> this works for me:  
10:33 <mflorea> {{documentTree showTranslations="false" showAttachments="false" compact="true" showSpaces="true" root="space:Sandbox" /}}  
10:34 <vmassol> try:  
10:34 <vmassol> root="space:xwiki:Sandbox"  
10:34 <mflorea> I created a nested document (space) Sandbox.Bar, and with this I can see the docs from Sandbox and the nested space  
10:34 <mflorea> still works with space:xwiki:Sandbox  
10:35 <vmassol> ok then try my gist in panel  
10:35 <mflorea> let me try  
10:35 <spawn57> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/vmassol/ffbffc028f01280f3f60  
10:37 <spawn57> hi, I'm trying to create a new page by copying a template page.  Is there a way to create from the template page without the history?  
10:37 <vmassol> hi spawn57  
10:38 <spawn57> Hi Vincent  
10:38 <spawn57> busy day?  
10:38 <mflorea> vmassol: if you display $openToSpace before the tree you'll get "Space xwiki:Panels". The reference needs to be serialized  
10:38 <vmassol> yes toString() does that  
10:38 <mflorea> toString is not good  
10:39 <vmassol> it's using the default serializer  
10:39 <vmassol> when I display  
10:39 <vmassol> "$doc.documentReference.parent.toString().replaceAll('([~"])', '~$1')"  
10:39 <vmassol> I get:  
10:39 <vmassol> xwiki:Panels  
10:40 <vmassol> spawn57: yup :) No idea about the history. Tried checking if there's a param but I don't see one  
10:40 <vmassol> (in EditForm)  
10:40 <mflorea> display $openToSpace, I'm not sure why I get "Space xwiki:Panels"  
10:40 <spawn57> yeah, me neither  
10:40 <spawn57> ...doesn't matter, I can do without it  
10:41 <mflorea> yes, I know, it's the toString  
10:41 <mflorea> ".parent.toString()" is not good  
10:41 <mflorea> because the parent is a space reference  
10:42 <mflorea> and thus you get "Space ...."  
10:42 <vmassol> and?  
10:42 <mflorea> the reference is prefix with the type  
10:42 <mflorea> it's not just the default serializer  
10:42 <mflorea> the DocumentReference uses only the serializer  
10:43 <vmassol> indeed, need to check why it works with a doc ref  
10:43 <mflorea> doc is treated specially  
10:43 <vmassol> I guess it overwrites toString  
10:43 <vmassol> indeed it does  
10:43 <vmassol> but SpaceReference doesn't  
10:43 <vmassol> ok so that explains that part, thanks  
10:44 <gsmeria> has quit  
10:44 <vmassol> let's go back to my other question:  
10:44 <vmassol> why did you say that what I wrote is false at "E.g.: wiki:xwiki,space:xwiki:Main, document:xwiki:Main.WebHome. If you use a space type then you must also specify showSpaces=true"?  
10:47 <mflorea> it's not completely false, but I don't think it's needed. We would have to add also "if you use a wiki then you must also specify showWikis=false" and "if you use a document then you must also specify showSpaces=false". I think this is implied.  
10:48 <vmassol> the fact is that it fails completely if you don't do that and it's not specified anywhere  
10:48 <vmassol> I can make the sentence generic  
10:50 <vmassol> I think there's a design problem  
10:50 <mflorea> IMO you first decide what kind of tree you want to display (nested documents, nested spaces, cross wiki, parent-child, etc.) and then if you want to choose a root, but you choose it after you see what types of nodes the tree has  
10:50 <vmassol> it should be called documentTreeMacro but entityTreeMacro since it can display various entities  
10:50 <vmassol> and we could have a documentTreeMacro for documents  
10:51 <vmassol> I don't agree that you have to use the macro before deciding how to pass parameters  
10:51 <vmassol> it's so non logical  
10:51 <vmassol> nobody would ever do that  
10:52 <mflorea> I said "you first decide what kind of tree you want to display"  
10:52 <mflorea> if you want nested documents, then why would you pass a space referece?  
10:52 <vmassol> very simple  
10:52 <mflorea> or, if you want nested space then why would you pass a document reference  
10:53 <vmassol> because I want to display all documents under a given space  
10:53 <mflorea> or, if you don't want wikis, why would you pass a wiki referecne  
10:53 <mflorea> it doesn't work like that  
10:53 <vmassol> yes and that's the problem  
10:53 <mflorea> see the showRoot parameter  
10:53 <vmassol> it's impossible to understand how ti works  
10:53 <vmassol> and it works different from any other existing macros  
10:53 <mflorea> the root needs to be "suppoted" by the current params  
10:53 <vmassol> (the logic I mean)  
10:54 <mflorea> "to display all documents under a given space" <--- what space  
10:54 <mflorea> we have nested documetns  
10:54 <vmassol> no  
10:54 <mflorea> the user sees nested documents  
10:54 <vmassol> ND are \*\*only\*\* at the level of UI  
10:54 <vmassol> at the level of macros and API we have NS  
10:54 <vmassol> not ND  
10:55 <mflorea> the tree is about the UI  
10:56 <mflorea> as a user I find it very confusing to use a macro where the params are not correlated with what I see on the UI  
10:58 <mflorea> I can see the user complaining "the documentation says I need to specify a space but I don't see any space on the UI"  
10:59 <vmassol> is it more correct now?  
10:59 <mflorea> yes, looks good  
11:00 <vmassol> so back to my use case, I want to display siblings of the currnet doc. So I need to compute the home of the space the current doc is in, right?  
11:01 <mflorea> right  
11:03 <vmassol> hmm I tihnk we're missing an api in ModelScriptService  
11:03 <vmassol> I'd like to not hardcode "WebHome" so I'll have to serialize and then call resolveDocument  
11:04 <vmassol> would have been better to have a rsolveDocument accepting a Reference as input  
11:08 <vmassol> ah no  
11:10 <vmassol> hmm yes  
11:11 <vmassol> ok hardcoding WebHome for now…  haven't found a solution...  
11:12 <mflorea> I've use $services.model.getEntityReference('DOCUMENT', 'default').name in a few places, but it's a bit too long :)  
11:12 <vmassol> ah yes forgot we had a SS API to get the value  
11:12 <vmassol> thanks  
11:12 <vmassol> will use that for now but it's not perfect indeed  
11:15 <vmassol> hmm it won't work mflorea  
11:15 <vmassol> I mean it won't fill the use case I had imagined  
11:15 <mflorea> I use it instead of hardcoding 'WebHome'  
11:15 <vmassol> since current docs are terminal pages  
11:16 <vmassol> no I mean the siblings panel  
11:16 <vmassol> can't work for both modes  
11:16 <vmassol> at once  
11:16 <vmassol> I'm workong on providing alternatives to SpaceDocs  
11:16 <vmassol> so I have Children and Siblings Panels  
11:17 <mflorea> ok, and what is the problem?  
11:17 <vmassol> but it doesn't fully replace it when you have termina docs  
11:18 <mflorea> why?  
11:18 <vmassol> for ex when you're in Sandbox/TestPage1  
11:18 <vmassol> with SpaceDocs you were seeing all the other sibling pages  
11:18 <vmassol> TestPage2, etc  
11:18 <vmassol> but Children and Silbings panels won't show them  
11:18 <mflorea> yes, and you can do this with the tree  
11:19 <mflorea> the tree rooted in Sandbox.WebHome  
11:20 <vmassol> hmm then i don't understand why it doesn't work  
11:20 <vmassol> I have done that for the Siblings Panel  
11:21 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/vmassol/bd44910175e159d26d0f  
11:21 <vmassol> wait  
11:21 <vmassol> my bad  
11:21 <vmassol> forgot to modify the call  
11:21 <vmassol> :)  
11:22 <vmassol> hmm doesn't help  
11:22 <vmassol> updated gist  
11:23 <mflorea> what do you get? still the "Loading..." message?  
11:23 <vmassol> I have 'no pages found" when on Sandbox/TestPage1  
11:23 <vmassol> XXX WebHome  
11:23 <vmassol> XXX Document xwiki:Sandbox.WebHome  
11:23 <vmassol> ah missing toString  
11:24 <mflorea> it's an EntityReference, so toString is not overwriten  
11:24 <mflorea> you need to serialize it  
11:24 <vmassol> yes  
11:29 <vmassol> ok works  
11:29 <vmassol> thanks for the help  
11:29 <mflorea> np  
11:30 <vmassol> hmm doesn't work in http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Panels/Siblings debugging  
11:34 <vmassol> hmm works, I wonder if there's some caching somewhere  
11:44 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:47 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:48 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:56 <cjd> Silly Question: Does it make sense that we might have a "realtime rendering infrastructure" ?  (A renderer which can parse the wysiwyg and generate wikitext in realtime in the browser)  
11:56 <cjd> this would allow people to collaborate using different editors at the same time  
11:57 <vmassol> yes I'd like to have reatime rendering, what's harder is to find the right UI for it  
11:57 <cjd> ahh yes  
11:57 <vmassol> FYI I had done a POC here: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/angular-rendering  
11:57 <vmassol> (about realtime rendering, not about UI)  
11:57 <cjd> If we wanted to port the rendering infrastructure to C, we could compile it to javascript (and have pretty good compiler warnings, tests, etc)  
11:58 <cjd> <trollface>  
11:58 <vmassol> (GWT is the java answer to that I guess)  
11:59 <cjd> GWT the Great WaiT  
11:59 <cjd> I think it's a bit dead now, seems google is quietly porting their stuff to Closure Compiler js  
12:02 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
12:02 <vmassol> mflorea: looking for a replacement of the Spaces panel. The Navigation Panel seems to be the best fit but it opens on the current node unfortunately. Any idea?  
12:04 <mflorea> vmassol: if we want to keep it then we can use the document tree with showSpaces=true  
12:06 <mflorea> we could even use showSpaces="true" and showTerminalDocuments="false" to show only the space nodes if we want to  
12:07 <Trefex> has quit  
12:08 <vmassol> I don't think we should keep it because it's called Spaces  
12:08 <mflorea> as for replacing it, I agree that the Navigation panel is a good replacement. I don't mind that it opens to the current node  
12:08 <vmassol> I'd be in favor of deprecating it  
12:08 <mflorea> we could keep it just in case some people prefer NS over ND  
12:08 <mflorea> but if we make an extension out of it then we can replace it  
12:08 <vmassol> even if they prefer NS, the nav panel shoudl work no?  
12:09 <mflorea> it will work, but it will display ND  
12:09 <mflorea> they can of course edit the Navigation panel and put showSpaces=true if they want to  
12:10 <mflorea> there's no automatic ND/NS switch  
12:10 <vmassol> IMO NS is a special case and by default we should be ND  
12:10 <mflorea> I agree  
12:10 <vmassol> ie not show NS panels by default in the Panel wizard
